name: Cold War
description: Steal weapons. Improvise gadgets. Evade capture. Uncover the conspiracy.The Story:On the run and fighting for your life, you are freelance journalist Matt Carter. Twelve hours after arriving in Moscow for a routine story, you've been stripped of all possessions, beaten unconscious and thrown into the KGB's political prison.

reviews.review_text: First, don't mind my record times. I played it while offline.  I give this game 7/10. This game seems to be stealth game but in later levels you can play it like Call of Duty and the stealth system in this game is not good too. The good things about this game are twisted and excited story, many creative tools that you can craft them and I like idea of camera that can use as weapon as well plus the fact that main character is reporter making this idea is very creative.

I haven't fully tested the steam version, but I have played the retail one. A thousand times. Long story short, you play as a guy named Matt Carter who is an undercover reporter and journalist who goes into Moscow to photograph a meeting with the Russian president. Then things go wrong. The game is a third person shooter which seems to, at times, feel much like the classic Deus Ex, where you can run into a room guns blazing, sneak in the shadows and knock people out, or just get from one door to the next. The conspiracy in here buffs up the plot quite a bit. If you can find this on sale, do it. You may get a couple days of gameplay out of it, depending on your styles. I'm glad I found this on sale. I'm just now picking it up after a couple years of not playing it. The game is from 2005, so if you don't care about graphics and prefer story and gameplay, this is a good pick. X-ray cameras were never this much fun.
this game is astonishing for its price, it has themes you will find in other games that are about stealth. it was worth the money
